translation: Dhāraṇī of the Amṛtôdhara Sutra Spoken by the Buddha

source_sentence: 南無素嚕皤耶(一)怛他揭多(去聲呼之)耶(二)怛姪他(三)唵(四)素嚕素嚕(五)皤囉素嚕(六)皤羅素嚕(七)莎呵(八)右取水一掬呪之七遍散於空中。
translation: "In the South, Suppu-Sugata(a)tathāgata(declension)(b)tamego(c)om(d)Śuru-Sugata(e)Ṛuru(f)Ṛuru(g)Ṛsuru(g)Ṛsahā(h)Ṛ right, take a squirt of water, dhurray it seven times, and scatter it in the air.

source_sentence: 其水一渧變成十斛甘露。
translation: One drop of that water becomes ten tubs of ambrosia.
All hungry ghosts will be able to drink it.
Nothing is left wanting, and they're all filled.
